pubinfo.publish: Minnesota DNR - Division of Fish & Wildlife - Wildlife Unit

descript.abstract:
This layer was developed as part of the Working Lands Initiative (WLI) to show current target areas within the state. The WLI is a joint effort between DNR, USFWS and other agencies and NGOs to target state, federal and private conservation efforts to the most valuable wetland complexes in the state.
This dataset was created to show current WLI Target Areas within the state of Minnesota. The data was compiled from several sources and should not be used for locational measurement.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this layer is to show rough boundaries of current WLI Target Areas for management purposes.
descript.supplinf: Prairie Pothole Region counties of Minnesota: Becker, Big Stone, Blue Earth, Brown, Carver, Chippewa, Clay, Cottonwood, Douglas, Faribault, Freeborn, Grant, Hennepin, Jackson, Kandiyohi, Kittson, Lac Qui Parle, Le Sueur, Lincoln, Lyon, Mahnomen, Marshall, Martin, McLeod, Meeker, Murray, Nicollet, Nobles, Norman, Otter Tail, Pennington, Pipestone, Polk, Pope, Red Lake, Redwood, Renville, Rice, Rock, Roseau, Scott, Sibley, Stearns, Steele, Stevens, Swift, Todd, Traverse, Waseca, Watonwan, Wilkin, Wright and Yellow Medicine

cntperp.cntorg: Minnesota DNR - Division of Fish & Wildlife - Wildlife Unit

dataqual.logic: Data are topologically correct using ArcGIS 9.3. All polygons are closed and lines intersect where intended.

enttyp.enttypd: Information related to the WLI Target Areas

attr.attrdef: Area of polygon in square meters
County or Counties that the WLI Target Area falls within.
Update to the polygon for this year.

edom.edomvd: If the Target Area is a new addition to the existing shapefile and the year it was added.
Documents whether a polygon was edited in the current shapefile. Ex. Polygon larger in 2008.
